newsitem.title: USA: U.S. spot LPGs largely steady in thin trade.
newsitem.headline: U.S. spot LPGs largely steady in thin trade.

text.p: U.S. spot propane prices were mostly steady in quiet late trade on Tuesday as buyers and sellers held in a standoff, traders said.
"There is still buying interest but sellers are reluctant to come off their highs and buyers are not sure which way to move," said one Kansas-based trader.
In the Mont Belvieu, Texas, hub, propane remained largely between 48.25 cents and 48.50 cents a gallon after interest by a major earlier today drove prices up.
Players said a strong Merc and low inventories are helping to support prices at these levels.
In Conway, Kansas, hub propane stayed steady at 44.75/45.00 cents in quiet activity.
Players said the other liquids were difficult to assess, given the quiet trade among the heavies and ethane all day.
Belvieu purity ethane was talked steady at 29.75/30.00 cents and ethane mix was about 0.75 to one cent lower.
-- Laney Salisbury New York Energy Desk +1 212 859 1631
